definition:
The [*Gelfond-Schneider constant*]{} $2^{\sqrt{2}}$ was one of the first
numbers to be proven to be transcendental by appying Gelfond’s theorem.
However, naming the constant after Gelfond and Schneider comes from Eric
Weisstein, with many people preferring to refer to it simply as 2 to the
power of square root of 2.

Its value in base 10 is approximately
2.66514414269022518865029724987313984827421131371. Its continued
fraction representation is neither terminating nor periodic, and begins
$$2 + \frac{1}{1 + \frac{1}{1 + \frac{1}{1 + \frac{1}{72 + \, \cdots}}}}$$
